questions.question: What is graphic design?

options.a: The art of creating visual content to communicate information or messages.
options.b: The process of creating a website.
options.c: A method of programming for visual elements.
options.d: The design of the structure of a building.

questions.question: What is the role of color in graphic design?

options.a: Color is used to evoke emotions, create a visual hierarchy, and communicate messages.
options.b: Color is only used to make designs more attractive.
options.c: Color serves no real purpose in graphic design.
options.d: Color is used to ensure a design looks expensive.

questions.question: What is the difference between RGB and CMYK color models?

options.a: RGB is used for print, while CMYK is used for digital designs.
options.b: RGB is for digital screens, while CMYK is for print.
options.c: RGB and CMYK are the same.
options.d: RGB is for sketches, and CMYK is for final design.

questions.question: What is a vector graphic?

options.a: A graphic made of pixels.
options.b: A graphic based on mathematical formulas that can be scaled without losing quality.
options.c: A photo-editing tool.
options.d: A low-resolution image format.

questions.question: What is the purpose of a logo in design?

options.a: To create a visual identity for a brand or product.
options.b: To decorate a design.
options.c: To convey complex messages in text form.
options.d: To increase the file size of a design.

questions.question: What is typography in graphic design?

options.a: The study of fonts and how they are used to enhance readability and communicate a message.
options.b: The art of drawing pictures.
options.c: The process of arranging images in a layout.
options.d: The use of colors in a design.

questions.question: What is the significance of white space (negative space) in a design?

options.a: It makes the design look empty.
options.b: It helps to balance the design and improves readability.
options.c: It makes designs cheaper to produce.
options.d: It is not important in design.

questions.question: What is a raster image?

options.a: An image made up of pixels, often used for photographs.
options.b: An image that can be scaled without losing quality.
options.c: A 3D model for designs.
options.d: A diagrammatic image.

questions.question: What is the difference between JPEG and PNG file formats?

options.a: JPEG supports transparency, while PNG does not.
options.b: JPEG is lossless, and PNG is lossy.
options.c: JPEG is lossy, and PNG supports transparency and is lossless.
options.d: PNG is only used for vector images.

questions.question: What are the basic design principles (alignment, contrast, repetition, proximity)?

options.a: They are the rules that guide the arrangement of elements in a design.
options.b: They are unrelated concepts in graphic design.
options.c: They are focused on color schemes only.
options.d: They are principles specific to typography.

questions.question: What is the rule of thirds in design?

options.a: A technique where an image is divided into three equal parts both horizontally and vertically.
options.b: A technique used to arrange text in a design.
options.c: A way to use three colors in a design.
options.d: A method for balancing text and images.

questions.question: What is the difference between serif and sans-serif fonts?

options.a: Serif fonts have small lines at the ends of characters, while sans-serif fonts do not.
options.b: Sans-serif fonts are used for print, while serif fonts are used for digital content.
options.c: Serif fonts are modern, while sans-serif fonts are traditional.
options.d: There is no difference between the two.

questions.question: What is the significance of hierarchy in graphic design?

options.a: It helps to organize the visual elements in a design to guide the viewer's eye.
options.b: It is only important for typography.
options.c: It is the technique used to align elements in a design.
options.d: It defines the size of an image.

questions.question: How do you choose an appropriate font for a design?

options.a: By selecting the most decorative font available.
options.b: By considering the readability, context, and tone of the design.
options.c: By picking the most expensive font.
options.d: By only using sans-serif fonts.

questions.question: What is a color palette, and why is it important in design?

options.a: A selection of colors used in a design to create a cohesive look.
options.b: A list of fonts used in the design.
options.c: The image editing tool for colors.
options.d: A pattern of colors used only for backgrounds.

questions.question: What is a mood board, and how is it used in design projects?

options.a: A collage of images, colors, textures, and fonts used to convey the visual style and feel of a project.
options.b: A blueprint for organizing the project timeline.
options.c: A software tool for graphic design.
options.d: A way to store design feedback.

questions.question: What is the difference between Adobe Photoshop and Adobe Illustrator?

options.a: Photoshop is used for vector graphics, and Illustrator is used for raster graphics.
options.b: Photoshop is for image editing, while Illustrator is for creating vector-based designs.
options.c: They are the same program with different names.
options.d: Illustrator is for photo manipulation, and Photoshop is for designing websites.

questions.question: What is a vector illustration, and when is it preferred over a raster illustration?

options.a: A vector illustration is made of pixels and is preferred for photo-realistic images.
options.b: A vector illustration is made of paths and can be scaled infinitely without losing quality, making it ideal for logos and icons.
options.c: Vector illustrations are only used for background images.
options.d: Raster illustrations are best for web design, while vector illustrations are best for print.

questions.question: How do you ensure readability in typography?

options.a: By using too many fonts.
options.b: By making the text too small.
options.c: By choosing legible fonts, proper font size, and good contrast with the background.
options.d: By using only uppercase letters.

questions.question: How does color psychology play a role in graphic design?

options.a: Color psychology helps to select colors for a design based on their emotional and psychological effects.
options.b: Color psychology is not important in graphic design.
options.c: Color psychology focuses only on the brightness of the colors.
options.d: Color psychology is used only for website design.

questions.question: What is the concept of visual hierarchy, and how can it be applied effectively in graphic design?

options.a: Visual hierarchy is the arrangement of elements in a design based on their importance, guiding the viewer's eye in a logical flow.
options.b: Visual hierarchy is a technique for selecting colors.
options.c: Visual hierarchy refers to the size of images used in design.
options.d: Visual hierarchy is irrelevant in design projects.

questions.question: What is a responsive design, and why is it important for websites?

options.a: A responsive design ensures that a website looks good and functions properly on various devices and screen sizes.
options.b: A responsive design is only used for mobile websites.
options.c: A responsive design is focused only on text formatting.
options.d: A responsive design is important for aesthetic purposes only.

questions.question: What is the purpose of using grids in graphic design?

options.a: To align elements and create balance, consistency, and structure in the design.
options.b: To make the design look more artistic.
options.c: To reduce the file size of the design.
options.d: To create a 3D effect in designs.

questions.question: How does the concept of brand identity relate to graphic design?

options.a: Brand identity is the visual and emotional elements that define a company, including its logo, colors, fonts, and design style.
options.b: Brand identity is only the logo of a company.
options.c: Brand identity only relates to how a brand sounds.
options.d: Brand identity is an internal document and not part of graphic design.

questions.question: What are the key differences between print design and digital design?

options.a: Print design involves creating designs for physical media, whereas digital design is for web and interactive media.
options.b: Print design uses only black and white, while digital design uses color.
options.c: Digital design has no limitations in terms of resolution, while print design is limited by physical media.
options.d: There are no key differences between the two.

questions.question: What is the significance of kerning in typography, and how does it affect readability?

options.a: Kerning is the space between individual letters. Proper kerning ensures the text is legible and visually balanced.
options.b: Kerning is the space between words, and it does not affect readability.
options.c: Kerning only applies to headline text, not body text.
options.d: Kerning refers to the color of the text in typography.

questions.question: What is the impact of responsive design on graphic design?

options.a: Responsive design ensures that graphics and layout adapt seamlessly to different screen sizes, improving user experience across devices.
options.b: Responsive design is unrelated to graphic design.
options.c: Responsive design only affects the text in a design.
options.d: Responsive design is mainly used in print-based designs.

questions.question: How does contrast affect the effectiveness of a design?

options.a: Contrast helps create visual interest, define hierarchy, and ensure readability by distinguishing different elements.
options.b: Contrast makes the design look complicated and difficult to read.
options.c: Contrast is only important in color selection.
options.d: Contrast should be avoided in graphic design.

questions.question: What are vector illustrations, and why are they preferred in certain types of graphic design projects?

options.a: Vector illustrations are made of paths and can be scaled infinitely without losing quality, making them ideal for logos and icons.
options.b: Vector illustrations are made of pixels and are best for photographs.
options.c: Vector illustrations are used for complex photo-realistic designs.
options.d: Vector illustrations are only used in web design.
